div.p: Greetings. You will learn about our situation from the bearer of this letter.
Yesterday, I received letters from Heidelberg indicating some disturbance at the university; for the most learned Mr. Stephan Sylvius is disputing about the Lord's Supper and defending our position.
We must pray to the Lord that the matter turns out well. I could not write more; I will write again another time.
I have scarcely recovered from a severe headache, which is growing stronger and stronger. Farewell with all friends. May 30, 1559.
Be vigilant, lest a papist school be established in the Valtellina, about which I will write another time. Yours, Bullinger.
To the most excellent man, Mr. Johannes Fabricius, faithful minister of the church in Chur, his dearest brother.
